column4: I wanna be able to change the start menu icon, the default orange one. Iv done what everyone has currently said and go to the /usr/share/icons/hicolor/48x48/ and replace the distributor-logo.png with the image I want and then refresh the panel. I did that. Then I was told to go where the themes are and go into the current theme Im currently use and find it in there. Iv tried everything but it won't let me change the start menu icon
and I really want to change it to complete my theme
right click on start menu icon and click edit
may work
I'll be able to change the orange icon from there?
not sure, at least eliminate that option
Lol thats funny
Nope nothing under there
are you sure it can be changed?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2841579

Yes, Iv seen many many many screenshots and people have it changed. Like some people have the Mac OS X look going on, so I see the blue apple. Iv seen some people with the Windows Vista Theme(which I'm almost complete with doing) and they have the Windows Vista orb there
Yup, iv been to that one as well and nothing works
install M$ :P
microsoft - just a little joke
Oh. I already do, have it on Dual boot. I'm just making things the nice vista look with the power of Beryl at my finger tips
Whoa, hold on, that url gave me, I think I just found out after re-doing it again
I must have missed something when I was reading that url you gave me before
if it doesn't have an immediate effect try Ctrl+alt+backspace key to restart GDM
Alrighty
Thanks, I missed something earlier when I was trying to change it. Thanks 4 the help :D
